title: How to Merge Images in Microsoft Paint on Windows 10

steps.title: Open the Microsoft Paint app.
steps.content: Open the Microsoft Paint app. Click the Start menu and type "paint" to quickly find it. You can also find it in your list of apps. If you don't have Paint, you can download it for free from the Microsoft Store . Use this method if you want to merge two photos side-by-side in Microsoft Paint on Windows 10. If you want to place an image on top of another image, see the next section instead.

steps.title: Click Paste on the top-left corner of the Paint screen.
steps.content: Click Paste on the top-left corner of the Paint screen. Be sure to click the part of the button with the down arrow. A drop-down menu should open.

steps.title: Click Paste from.
steps.content: Click Paste from . This will open your File Explorer.

steps.title: Select the first image and click Open.
steps.content: Select the first image and click Open . The first image will be pasted onto Paint. Alternatively, you can copy the image and paste it into Paint. If the image is too big or too small, click and drag the square at the corner of the image inwards to make it smaller or outwards to make it bigger.

steps.title: Adjust the size of the canvas.
steps.content: Adjust the size of the canvas. It must be big enough to fit both of your images side by side. Make it a little bigger than you think you need; you can always crop the extra space out later. To increase the canvas size, drag the square at the bottom-right corner outwards.

steps.title: Insert the second image.
steps.content: Insert the second image. Click Paste and Paste from again. Select the second image, and then click Open . Alternatively, copy and paste the second image into Paint.

steps.title: Move the second image.
steps.content: Move the second image. Once the image is pasted, it will automatically be selected. Click and drag it next to the first image. If needed, click and drag the corner square to resize the image. If the selection border is gone, press CTRL + Z to undo the action, and then add the second image again.

steps.title: Crop the canvas (optional).
steps.content: Crop the canvas (optional). If you have extra space on the side of your image, click and drag the side or corner square to crop the canvas.

steps.title: Save the merged image.
steps.content: Save the merged image. Click File and Save as in the top-left corner. Enter a name for the new image file, and then click Save . Your new merged image is now saved.

steps.title: Open the first image in Microsoft Paint.
steps.content: Open the first image in Microsoft Paint. Right-click the first image file, click Open with , and then select Paint . This will be the image you want on top. This works best with images that have transparent areas. Use this method if you want to put one image on top of another image in Microsoft Paint on Windows 10, such as a logo on top of a background.

steps.title: Open the second image in Microsoft Paint.
steps.content: Open the second image in Microsoft Paint. Right-click the second file, click Open with , and then select Paint . This will be the image you want on the bottom. You should have two Paint windows open.

steps.title: On the first image window, click Select.
steps.content: On the first image window, click Select . This is in the top toolbar. Be sure to click the part of the button with the down arrow. A drop-down menu should open.

steps.title: Click Transparent selection.
steps.content: Click Transparent selection . This is the bottom option. You should see a check next to it.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+A.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + A . This is the Select All keyboard shortcut. You can also right-click the image and click Select All .

steps.title: Press Ctrl+C.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + C . This will copy the image to your clipboard. You can also right-click the image and select Copy .

steps.title: Navigate to the second image and press Ctrl+V.
steps.content: Navigate to the second image and press Ctrl + V . This will paste the image. You can also right-click the canvas and select Paste . If the image pastes without transparency, click Select in the toolbar, and click Transparent selection .

steps.title: Move the image.
steps.content: Move the image. Click and drag the image to move it to the desired position. To resize it, click and drag the side or corner square.

steps.title: Save the new image.
steps.content: Save the new image. Click File and Save as in the top-left corner. Enter a name for the new image file, and then click Save . Your new image is now saved.
